review_blob:
Hazy straw peach color with powerful activity. Extra foamy, almost creamy, white sparkly 3 finger head, lasting around 15 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of fresh apple and sweet grains, slightly metallic. Flavors of citrus lemon, coriander, apple, peach, pineapple, fruit ester, honey/caramel, floral and herbal spices. Bready and woody/oaky feel. Highly sweet but still sharp.

Slick medium body with prickly carbonation. Well intensified medium strength finish, ending with a slightly vinous fruity estery feel with a dash of spices.

Overall an excellent craft having good freshness and nice complex flavors, well balanced and intensified. Pretty good but not my favorite Belgian Ale.

Bright straw color with weak activity. White 1 finger head, lasts 5 minutes, with poor legs.

Aromas and flavors of corn, sweet roasted malts, a little herbal spices. High on the sugar with a syrupy feel, and bit bready.

Slick light body with moderate carbonation. Faint finish ending with a roasted malt feel, slightly bitter dry.

Overall a dull craft having faint watery adjunct flavors. Too sugary and thin, but still fresh. Even from tap it doesnt help.

Hazy straw color with weak activity. Foamy white 2 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with some good legs.

Aromas of fresh sweet grains, vinous citrus, and slightly floral. Flavors of lemony citrus, fruity ester, sweet malts, floral and herbal spices. Strong citrus sharpness balanced with nice malt sugar. Tasty, balanced, and super fresh.

Smooth medium body with champagne like carbonation. Well intensified medium strength crispy clean finish, ending with a perfect touch of spices and some floral notes.

Overall an exquisite craft having great freshness and delicious flavors. Quite accessible having almost no perception of alcohol and low on the spices. One of the best Belgian ale out there.

Veiled dark brown copper color with moderate activity. Slightly foamy light brown 2 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with some good legs.

Aroma of toffee and vinous dark fruits, a little faint. Flavors of dark berries, grapes, caramel, tobacco, herbal spices. Bready with a strong fruity estery sugary syrupy feel.

Slick medium body with prickly carbonation. Well intensified medium strength finish, ending with herbal spicy hops and a thick fruity tongue coat.

Overall a pretty good craft having decent flavors and a nice balance. Slightly off with the freshness being highly vinous.

Slightly hazy straw color with low activity. Foamy white 3 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with strong legs.

Fresh floral and fruity scent. Flavors of strawberries, banana, tropical fruits, pears, peach, and citrus wow. Fresh fruity vinous sugary feel with a citrus sharpness, well balanced.

Slick medium body with champagne like carbonation. Strong spicy finish of moderate length, ending with a powerful dash of spices that lingers a little but clears out quickly.

Overall an excellent craft having a pleasant bouquet and very good flavors. A little bit overly spicy but still the freshness is quite good and smooth to drink.

Slightly cloudy straw/golden color with strong activity. Weak foamy white 1 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with poor legs.

Aromas of floral hops and sweet malt, too faint. Flavors of roasted corn and grains, lime, slight ginger, black pepper, mint, floral and herbal spices. A little grassy and bready with minimal hops. Well balanced sugary malt and sharp crispy feel.

Light body with moderate carbonation. Faint and short finish on the bitter side, ending with hints of herbal spices, slightly peppery, but having a strong adjunct roasted corn aftertaste.

Overall an average blonde having decent flavors, good balance, and some nice freshness. The spices are faint and not overwhelming the other flavors, while the adjunct corn is overly present. Could be more minty and less corny.

Opaque black color with no visible activity. Creamy brown 1 finger sparkly head, lasting around 10 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of pleasant woody roasted nuts and toffee, though a little faint. Flavors of light coffee and cocoa, nuts, dark fruits, toffee, and herbal spices. Highly roasted bitter taste with low sweetness. Also a little vinous from the fruits.

Milky smooth medium body with prickly carbonation. Strong bitter finish of medium length, ending with a fruity dark berries, cherry feel, and spicy herbs. Roasted and oaky feel lingering on the tongue.

Overall one of my favorite sour stout having incredible body and complexity. Although not the most visually appealing nor strong on the smell, it have some of the most delicious flavors and a great refreshing feel.
beer_name: Charlevoix Vache Folle Imperial Milk Stout

review_blob:
Slightly hazy straw color with strong activity. Foamy white 3 finger head, lasting around 15 minutes, with some good legs.

Fresh floral aroma with sweet grainy malt. Flavors of grains, corn, lemon, honey, herbal and floral spices. Nice grassy and quality malty biscuity feel with a little roasted smoky corn. Highly crispy with a pleasant dose of sugar.

Slick light body with champagne like carbonation. Balanced medium strength clean finish, ending with a faint citrusy and slightly dry tongue numbing noble spices.

Overall an excellent craft having delicious balanced flavors and great freshness.
Well spiced and accessible. Im in love with Klsch now!
beer_name: Le Trou du Diable Pitoune Pils

review_blob:
Slightly veiled dark golden color with high activity. Foamy white 2 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with average legs.

Aromas of citrus and wheat. Flavors of grains, orange, lemon, banana, corn, caramel. A little bready with highly syrupy sweetness and minimal sharpness. Light bodied with a faint straw finish and minimal spices.

Overall an average beer having faint smell and flavors with an adjunct and unbalanced feel. Passable freshness being a little boozy and vinous.

Hazy straw/golden color with strong activity. Super foamy white 4 finger head, lasting around 15 minutes, with some good legs.

Aromas of fresh pear, zesty and grainy. Taste like pear cider and highly vinous. Sweet grainy feel with a sour zesty end.

Light body with prickly carbonation. Fruity finish with a dry boozy end.

Overall its a decent craft with a nice warming flavor and acceptable freshness while a little flat and light. Also a little too vinous and cider like.

Cloudy copper color with moderate strength activity. Creamy orange beige 2 finger head, lasting around 15 minutes, with strong legs.

Strong aromas of caramel, sweet hops, and slightly floral. Flavors of citrus including orange and lemon, grapes and dark fruits, caramel, floral and herbal spices. Bready, grassy, a little roasted and syrupy. Well balanced sweetness and sharpness.

Creamy full body with perfect carbonation. Medium strength and length finish, ending with bitter fruit peels and clove with a touch of herbal spices. Not to rough.

Overall a good craft with decent flavors that are well balanced being not excessively bitter nor too sugary. Though missing some freshness and a little flat. With some tuning this could be an excellent IPA.

Almost opaque dark brown color with a copper hue and faint activity. Light brown 2 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with average legs.

Aromas of bacon and smoked salmon on wood. Flavors of smoky meat, tobacco, roasted coffee, caramel, and herbal spices. Feels like bread mixed with wood and bacon. Well balanced between sweetness and bitterness.

Full body with prickly carbonation. Strong finish of medium length, ending with a spicy smoky meaty beef jerky feel, still with a nice balance from the sweet and sour.

Overall this is my first of this style and not really a fan. Incredible experience to try, yes, but is it a beer that I enjoy or would I drink it again, no. Still perfectly drinkable to the last drop with complex and interesting flavors. The smoky meaty bacon taste is overwhelming the other flavors. The body is flat and missing some freshness. Sure Im a bacon lover but not in my beer!

Veiled straw color a good dose of activity. White 1.5 finger head, lasting for around 7 minutes, with average legs.

Zesty and floral aromas. Flavors of coriander, lemon, slight corn, sweet smoky grains, floral and herbal spices. Some syrupy sweetness and faint sharpness. Straw and woodsy feel.

Slick light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Faint and short finish, ending with a basic floral and coriander feel.

Overall an average craft having weak flavors and moderate freshness that is slightly flat. Feels a little adjunct and missing some personality.
beer_name: RJ Le Cheval Blanc Blanche (de Bl)

review_blob: Taste reminiscent of a Coors Light but less syrupy and less dry. Nice smoky grainy feel in the aftertaste. Still highly corny and strong on the sugar. Faint flavors and thin body. Refreshing on a hot summer day, pointless in any other situations.
Taste much like a Corona but more sugary and less bitter and skunky. Still very corny and syrupy. Good refreshing beer in the hot summer and thats about it, faint taste and a weak body.

Veiled golden color with strong subtle activity and some detritus. Creamy white 2 finger head, lasting around 15 minutes, with good legs.

Aromas of citrus and rich hops. Flavors of smoky pine, lemon, orange, grapes, coriander, clove, caramel, floral and herbal spices. Highly grassy and a little woody. A little sugary with more of a sharp citrus and herbal feel.

Slick medium body with prickly carbonation. Medium strength finish of moderate length, ending with a sharp hoppy, citrus, and strong piney feel on the tongue.

Overall a pretty good craft that is more like an IPA than the typical APA. Good freshness and a nice taste while overly piney with lots of diacetyl.

Cloudy golden color with some powerful activity. Extra foamy white 3 finger head, lasting around 20 minutes, with average legs.

Aromas of fresh fruity citrus and floral notes. Flavors of sweet grains, apple, melon, peach, pineapple, lemon, passion fruits, caramel, floral and herbal spices. Some faint grassy and citrus bitterness with more of a sweet fruity and malty feel.

Slick full body with champagne like carbonation. Medium finish of short length, ending with a perfect dose of sharp herbal and coriander spicy hops and some sweet grainy citrusy tongue coat.

Overall an excellent belgian style craft having super fresh and flavorful with a gentle pleasing taste, but a little vinous or boozy.
beer_name: Le Trou du Diable Saison du Tracteur

review_blob:
Hazy straw color with powerful subtle activity. Super foamy white 4 finger expanding island head, lasting around 20 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of sweet malty grains, citrus, and a little vinous. Flavors of lemon, apple, pear, caramel, floral and herbal spices. Pleasant sweet grainy biscuity feel with a nice citrus sharpness. Balanced taste and not too boozy.

Slick medium body with perfect carbonation. Well intensified medium strength finish of short length, ending with a clean sharp citrus and slightly spicy noble hops feel.

Overall a very good craft with a super fresh taste of delicious complex flavors, while the nose is a little faint. Very easy to drink and quite treacherous.

Almost opaque dark amber copper color with average glass clinging activity. Extra foamy sparkly beige 3 finger island head, lasting around 15 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of sweet fresh fruits like apple and a little metallic. Flavors of caramel, apple, dark fruits, clove, floral and herbal spices. Balanced sweet syrupy taste with a sharp smoky black peppery feel and slightly bready.

Slick full body with perfect carbonation. Well intensified finish of medium length, ending with a slightly spicy clove like feel with a woody and cider like fruity mouth coat.

Overall an excellent craft with super fresh delicious balanced flavors and nice intensity having no perception of alcohol. A true pleasure to drink!

Veiled dark amber, almost copper color, with subtle activity. Creamy light brown 2 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with good legs.

Stout like aromas of biscuity caramel and roasted nuts. Flavors of toffee, molasses, nuts, apple, black pepper, herbal spices. Smoky woody feel with a strange stale bread taste having some sweetness but overwhelming bitterness.

Medium body with prickly carbonation. Strong and long finish, ending with an highly bitter roasted and smoky nuts feel coating the tongue.

Overall I dont like this craft being highly bitter in a harsh bad way with unpleasant unbalanced flavors and bad freshness. Doesnt really taste like an IPA, more like a mix of cream ale and red ale.

Hazy dark gold color with strong activity. Weak white half a finger head, lasting around 5 minutes, with strong legs.

Faint aromas of sweet tropical fruits and bitter floral hops. Flavors of pineapple, orange, piney, lemon, caramel, floral and herbal spices. Slightly fruity sweet with some citrus sharpness and bitter grassy hoppy feel.

Slick medium body with prickly carbonation. Strong and long finish, ending with an highly spicy astringent orange peels and clove like tongue coat feel.

Overall a good craft with decent flavors and OK freshness. Slightly unbalanced being overly spicy and a little vinous and boozy.

Brewed for the Marathon Baie-des-Chaleurs in Carleton-sur-mer as a session beer for the event. Ltape du phare is translated as "Lighthouse stage". The runners have to go at the lighthouse on a peninsula and run back to shore.

Bright dark gold, almost amber color, with strong activity. Foamy white sparkly 2 finger head, lasting around 15 minutes, with good legs.

Aromas of floral spices and citrus. Nice floral taste with a grainy bread like feel. Sharp citrus feel of lemon and orange with hints of sweet honey and fruity pineapple and mango. Good balance and packed with flavors.

Medium body with perfect carbonation. Well intensified medium finish of short length, ending with a slightly bitter spicy clove and coriander feel lingering on the tongue.

Overall a good craft with tasty rich flavors for the low ABV, well balanced, easy to drink and accessible. Passable freshness being a little flat.

Veiled dark gold, almost amber color, with powerful activity. Thick creamy sparkly white 2 finger head, lasting around 20 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of sweet fruits and caramel, a little faint. Flavors of zesty citrus like orange and lemon, caramel, clove, pine, mint, herbal spices. Balanced sweet and sour taste. Grassy and slightly bready.

Medium body with perfect carbonation. Medium strength and long finish, ending with
a faint sweet zest and a bitter astringent but still pleasant spicy hoppy and piney tongue coat feel.

Overall a good craft having tasty complex flavors and great balance. The freshness is passable while the body is a little flat with a perceptible alcohol feel.
beer_name: Le Trou du Diable la Morsure

review_blob:
Hazy dark amber, almost copper color, with strong activity. Creamy beige 2 finger head, lasting around 15 minutes, with good legs.

Pleasant aromas of sweet bread and butterscotch. Flavors of caramel, rye, fruits, floral and herbal spices. Good grainy and bready taste with a nice balance of sweetness and sharpness.

Creamy medium body with moderate carbonation. Medium strength finish of moderate length, ending with a sharp crispy floral and herbal spices.

Overall a very good craft; delicious flavors and refreshing, nice balance and easy to drink.
beer_name: Brasseurs du Monde Gamme Passion Seiglerie Bitter

beer_brewer_name: Microbrasserie Le Castor - Le Castor Brewing Co.
review_blob:
Hazy dark golden, almost amber color, with powerful activity. Thick foamy and creamy beige 3 finger island head, lasting more than 30 minutes, with super strong legs.

Aromas of fresh piney citrus and straw. Flavors of fruits like pineapple, melon with some citrus like orange, lemon including floral and herbal spices. Pleasant fruity sweetness with a sharp crispy fresh grassy feel.

Slick medium body with champagne like carbonation. Well intensified strong finish of medium length, ending with some sweet citrus and a nice spicy hoppy feel.

Overall an awesome beer with incredible visuals and inviting smell. Delicious complex flavors and a well balanced finish with a super refreshing feel being not too excessive.

Hazy deep straw, almost golden color, with powerful activity. Foamy and creamy sparkly white 2 finger head, lasting around 20 minutes, with very strong legs.

Pleasant aromas of fresh citrus and rich hops. Flavors of orange, lemon, grapes, pine, coriander, clove, floral and herbal spices. Well balanced flavors, slightly sugary with a strong sharp and crispy feel.

Slick full body with perfect carbonation. Strong and extra long finish, ending with a highly spicy fruity orange peel and piney feel progressively attacking the tongue in a unique way.

Overall an excellent craft with delicious flavors and very fresh, though overly spicy and highly astringent making this one a little hard to drink.
beer_name: Dieu du Ciel / The Alchemist Moralit

review_blob:
Clear pale straw color with moderate activity. White 1 finger head, lasting around 5 minutes, with good legs.

Faint citrus smell. Flavors of sweet grains, corn, lemon, banana, honey, vegetal, herbal spices. Well balanced sweet taste with a nice sharp crispy feel. Grassy and slightly syrupy.

Medium body with prickly carbonation. Faint finish of medium length, ending with a slightly bitter and skunky noble spices.

Overall a decent craft with nice flavors, but a little faint, and some good freshness.

Opaque black color with no visible activity. Creamy light brown 2 finger head, lasting around 15 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of butterscotch and sweet bread. Flavors of molasses, toffee, dark berries, coffee, cocoa, nuts and herbal spices. Some sweetness and a well intensified bitter taste with a strong smoky roasted earthy feel, but a little metallic.

Milky slick medium body with average carbonation. Strong finish of medium length, ending with an dry bitter earthy herbal spicy feel, not too harsh, and a slight syrupy coating.

Overall a good craft with pleasant flavors, well balanced and intensified, and good freshness being not too flat.

Opaque dark brown, almost black color, with strong activity on the sides of the glass. Creamy light brown 2 finger head, lasting 10 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of sweet toffee and roasted spices. Flavors of nuts, toffee, molasses, maple syrup, grains, whisky, and herbal spices. More of a sweet sugary taste than bitter and lots of spices. Complex having feelings of sweet bread, roasted nuts, woody and earthy with hints of pine and oak.

Milky slick medium body with moderate carbonation. Well intensified finish of medium length, ending with a spicy roasted malt and bitter earthy herbal feel, and a syrupy maple tongue coat. A little alcoholic.

Overall a decent craft with complex flavors but a little off with a slight wet cardboard taste (maybe a bad bottle?). Missing some freshness and a little flat.
beer_name: Dieu du Ciel quinoxe du Printemps

beer_brewer_name: Prince Edward Island Brewing Company (The Gahan House)
review_blob:
Slightly hazy dark amber color with powerful carbonation. Creamy beige 2 finger head, lasting around 15 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of fresh bread and caramel. Flavors of grains, burnt caramel, roasted nuts, lemon, melon, and herbal spices. Well balanced flamb and biscuity sweet taste with a nice sharp grainy feel. Slightly earthy.

Creamy full body with perfect carbonation. Well intensified finish of medium length, ending with a sharp crispy herbal feel and a fruity/caramel tongue coat.

Overall a very good craft with complex delicious flavors, super fresh feel, and well balanced.

Veiled dark amber color with dense activity. Creamy white 2 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of citrus, fruits, milk, and straw. Flavors of orange, lemon, apple, lime, caramel, pine, coriander, and herbal spices. Slightly sweet with a strong thick bitter taste. Bready and grassy.

Creamy milky full body with perfect carbonation. Strong and long finish, ending with a powerful herbal bitter feel and a numbing clovey tongue coat.

Overall a good craft with refreshing tasty flavors, while a little vinous with perception of alcohol and overly spicy for my taste.
beer_name: Charlevoix Vache Folle Summit Double IPA

review_blob:
Opaque dark brown, almost black color, with strong activity. Creamy and foamy sparkly light brown 3 finger island head, lasting around 20 minutes, with strong legs.

Pleasant floral and fruity nose. Flavors of toffee, grains, apricot, banana, coriander, clove, floral and herbal spices. Strong caramel and fruity sweetness creating a toasty and bread feel.

Milky light body with prickly carbonation. Faint and short finish, ending with a fruity and herbal spicy thick tongue feel. A little vinous and flat.

Overall a good craft with decent flavors, a fresh smell, and a superb look. A little stale and flat. Unbalanced being overly sweet with a weird rotten banana feel.

Slightly hazy copper and amber colors with strong subtle activity. Creamy beige sparkly 2 finger head, lasting 15 minutes, with strong legs.

Nice caramel and spicy hops smell. Flavors of toffee, molasses, dark berries, apples, lemon, coriander, and herbal spices. Well balanced syrupy sweetness having a bready feel, coupled with a pleasant sharp citrus, fruity, and spicy grassy feel.

Slick medium body with moderate carbonation. Strong finish of medium length, ending with some crisp citrus sourness and thick noble spices on the tongue.

Overall a solid craft offering excellent flavors that are well balanced and intensified, with crispy freshness. A little heavy on the spices but still enjoyable.

Hazy golden amber color with super strong activity. Thick foamy beige 4 finger island head, lasting almost forever, with strong legs.

Pleasant floral and fresh apple nose. Well intensified flavors of apples, pears, grapes, and sweet grains with floral and herbal spices. Balanced fruity sweetness with a sharp crispy fresh grassy and slight coriander feel.

Slick full body with champagne like carbonation. Well intensified finish, ending with a fresh fruity feel and a pleasant honey/maple tongue coat.

Overall an excellent craft offerring delicious complex flavors and great freshness. Visually appealing, well intensified, balanced, and accessible. The only flaw is a slightly metallic feel.

Clear straw, almost golden color, with average activity. White 2 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with some good legs.

Faint sweet grains and citrus smell, with a hint of metal. Flavors of fresh grains, lemon, lime, and herbal spices. Strong syrupy taste of bread, biscuits, and slightly grassy.

Slick light body with prickly carbonation. Well balanced finish, ending with slightly dry wine like sweet grainy feel and pleasant tongue numbing noble spices.

Overall a good craft offering decent flavors, good freshness, and a nice warming finish. Although a little unbalanced being too syrupy.

From tap : Opaque black color with no visible activity. Creamy brown 1 finger head, lasting around 5 minutes, with poor legs.

Strong aromas of coffee and chocolate. Flavors of cocoa, roasted coffee, toffee, molasses, nuts and herbal spices. Some slight sweetness with an overly bitter roasted and earthy feel.

Milky medium body with faint carbonation. Strong finish of medium length, ending with a dry bitter nutty roasted malts and an astringent herbal earthy feel.

Overall an average craft offering a good taste while overly spicy being harsh on the palate and lacking balance. Feels a little stale and flat.

Cloudy golden color with some powerful activity. Thick foamy white sparkly 3 finger head, lasting around 15 minutes, with strong legs.

Sweet grains and citrus smell, a little faint. Flavors of fresh grains, lemon, orange with hints of clove and coriander. Well balanced with a pleasant rich sweet bread taste and a slightly sharp and crispy citrus and herbal feel.

Slick full body with perfect carbonation. Well intensified and short clean finish, ending with pleasant floral spices and fruity sugary banana and honey feel lingering on the tongue.

Overall an exquisite craft offering complex and delicious flavors, great freshness, extremely well balanced, accessible, and a true joy to drink!

Cloudy dark amber color with poor activity. Beige 1 finger head, lasting around 5 minutes, with poor legs.

Aromas and flavors of citrus, fruits, pine, floral and herbal spices. Piney and floral nose. Taste of lemon, orange, pears, coriander, pine, and clove. Some sweetness but more of a sharp bitter grassy taste.

Creamy heavy body with perfect carbonation. Strong and long finish, ending with a bitter hoppy clove and piney lasting astringent feel on the tongue.

Overall a good craft with decent flavors and good freshness, while slightly unbalanced being too spicy and coarse.
beer_name: Le Bien, Le Malt La Numro 8

review_blob:
Hazy golden amber color with poor activity. Thick white 1 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with average legs.

Aromas and flavors of caramel, grains, nuts, floral and herbal spices. Butterscotch nose. Taste of sweet grains, burnt sugar and roasted nuts. More sharp than sweet and slightly grassy.

Slick medium body with perfect carbonation. Strong finish of medium length, ending with a coarse floral mouth coat, coriander and piney feel.

Overall an average craft with good freshness while overly spicy and lacking some flavors like citrus or fruits.

From tap : Clear straw, almost golden color, with poor activity. White 1 finger head, lasting around 5 minutes, with poor legs.

Aromas and flavors of citrus, pine, fruits, caramel, floral and herbal spices. Floral and piney nose. Taste of lemon and orange with some thick coriander and strong piney spices. More bitter than sweet with a grassy and woody feel.

Slick medium body with prickly carbonation. Strong finish of medium length, ending with a highly spicy bitter tongue coat and dry grassy feel.

Overall a little off; doesnt really feel like a white beer, more like a pale ale. The freshness is alright, but the flavors are too strong, overly spicy, with a perceptible alcohol feel.

From tap : Cloudy straw color with faint activity. White half a finger head dead in a minute with weak legs.

Aromas and flavors of citrus, grains, fruits, honey, floral and herbal spices. Floral and coriander nose. Taste of sweet grains and honey, giving a slightly bread feel, with some sharp lemon and orange mixed with coriander and clove spices.

Slick medium body with moderate carbonation. Medium strength and short finish, ending with a floral and hoppy, strong spicy feel.

Overall a decent craft with good freshness and tasty flavors while the spices are a little too strong.
beer_name: La Barberie Blanche Miel et Agrumes (Mondaine)

review_blob:
Veiled light straw/peach color with no activity. Poured from tap it has no head and weak legs.

Aromas and flavors of citrus, fruits, grains, floral and herbal spices. Sweet grainy smell. More of a sharp taste with some lemon, orange, pear, and a strong coriander and clove feel.

Light body with prickly carbonation. Medium strength finish ending with a floral and citrusy feel.

Overall an average craft having slightly off flavors with a overly spicy coriander taste, and lacking a little freshness.

Hazy amber color with no visual activity. Thick white 2 finger head, lasting around 20 minutes, with average legs.

Aromas and flavors of toffee, fruits, citrus, nuts, herbal spices. Faint butterscotch nose. Well balanced sweetness and sourness. Nice mix of caramel, lemon, apple, and grapes. Bready and slightly grassy.

Slick medium body with faint carbonation. Well intensified finish of short length, ending with a slightly bitter roasted nuts and sweet grassy feel.

Overall a very good craft with delicious flavors, nice balance, and very refreshing. Accessible and easy to drink.

From tap : Veiled amber color with no visual activity. White 1 finger head dead in 2 minutes with faint legs.

Aromas and flavors of citrus, fruits, grains, floral and herbal spices. Faint hoppy and floral smell. Taste of orange and lemon with hints of coriander and peach. Well balanced between sweetness and sharpness.

Slick medium body with perfect crisp carbonation. Well intensified finish ending with a pleasant grassy and fruity hoppy finish.

Overall an excellent craft with delicious flavors, nice balance, and a great sharp fresh crispy feel. Only lacking visually.

Bright straw color with poor activity. Foamy white 3 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with good legs.

Aromas and flavors of grains, citrus, and herbals spices. Fresh grainy smell. Well balanced sweet grainy taste with some sharp lemon. Grassy with a slight bread feel.

Slick medium body with prickly carbonation. Faint finish of medium length, ending with a slightly grassy feel with a nice dose of noble spices.

Overall a good craft with well balanced pleasant and rich malt flavors, accessible, and a super refreshing taste.

Almost opaque reddish dark brown color with a copper hue and no visible activity. Very small head lasting 5 minutes with weak legs.

Aromas and flavors of fruits, caramel, herbal spices. Smell like fruity wine. Strong sweet vinous taste of dark berries and grapes, similar to Port, with some spicy hops.

Slick light body with faint carbonation. Well intensified finish of moderate length, ending with a slightly dry sweet dark fruits and spicy herbal mouth feel.

Overall I find it average; this is my first barleywine so I have not much experience with this brevage. As a first try, I find it overly sugary but still very tasty with a nice fruity effect, though lacking some freshness being extremely vinous.

From cask : Opaque black color with a nice slow visual construction. Creamy sparkly light brown 3 finger island head with a nice sharp definition, lasting around 15 minutes, with average legs.

Aromas and flavors of coffee, nuts, cocoa, fruits, molasses, herbal spices. Strong delicious flavors of chocolate and cappuccino with a powerful roasted nuts feel and hints of dark berries. Thick and rich taste but still well intensified earthy and oak feel.

Milky creamy heavy body with no carbonation. Strong spicy finish but still enjoyable with good balance from the sweetness. Ending with a bitter smoky roasted nuts and dark berry feel.

Overall a great craft with strong but delicious flavors, highly spicy but still fresh with no perception of alcohol nor a harsh dry feel, well intensified and balanced the way I like a stout.

Opaque black color with no visual activity. Pouring from tap it has a slightly creamy light brown 1 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with average legs.

Aromas and flavors of coffee, cocoa, fruits, nuts, herbal spices. Roasted and earthy bitter taste with a strong coffee feel. The cherry sweetness is minimal and feeling almost medicinal with a bit of metallic feel.

Milky medium body with no carbonation. Strong finish of medium length, ending with some bitter roasted malts and herbal spicy feel.

Overall an average craft with decent flavors while unbalanced, highly spicy, slightly flat and stale.

Opaque black color with no visible activity. Thick creamy sparkly brown 2 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with good legs.

Aromas and flavors of cocoa, coffee, nuts, toffee, vanilla, herbal spices. Well balanced flavors including a rich sweet chocolate and toffee taste coupled with a slightly bitter roasted nuts and mocha feel. Nice warming earthy and woody feel.

Slick milky medium body with moderate carbonation. Well intensified and balanced finish leaving a pleasant sweet chocolate and vanilla coating on the mouth, ending with a slightly bitter herbal spicy feel.

Overall an excellent craft with delicious complex flavors and great balance. A little thin but quite fresh. I like this one better than Pch Mortel.

Slightly hazy golden color with poor activity. Creamy white 1 finger head, lasting around 5 minutes, with average legs.

Aromas and flavors of pine, citrus, grains, floral and herbal hops. Nice fresh pine and floral nose. Sharp lemony, orange, and piney taste with a strong rich hoppy and grassy feel.

Slick full body with perfect carbonation. Strong and long bitter finish, ending with an overly sour and spicy astringent mouth feel.

Overall a decent IPA; good flavors and freshness while too aggressive being very spicy without a balanced fruity or sugary feel. Better for those who like sourness.
